Issues.Title: Small router refactors
Issues.Body:
1. refactor(router): Update match result to be more explicit

The `lastChild` property in the match result is only used to compute the
remaining segments (i.e. the ones which were not consumed). The updated
type here makes it easier to use and more clear.

2. refactor(router): Refactor errors in applyRedirects to use common throwError function

The implementation of `throwError` in `rxjs` is identical to what is
done manually in the Router code.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Small router refactors" (#45170)

Issues.Title: refactor(forms): split apart `model.ts`
Issues.Body:
In the forms package, the main abstractions for controls were previously defined in a file `model.ts`, which contained several thousand lines of code. This made changing the forms abstractions in any way a challenging operation. Additionally, there were several import cycles involving this file and other parts of the forms system.

In this commit, `model.ts` is broken out into a number of files. Several strategies were used to effect this refactoring:

 * The interfaces of the main abstractions are interdependent, and are split out into a separate `model/api.ts` file.
 * Each interface is implemented by a private implementation class.
 * Constructors for each abstraction are defined with a separate constructor signature, and a `const` constructor declaration which is merged with
   the interface type.
 * The `_find` operation, which previously depended on `instanceof` checks with the actual constructor types to achieve different behavior for different types of controls, has been refactored to rely on an internal method on the `AbstractControl` hierarchy instead.

Together, these changes will make the forms package much more maintainable, and pave the way for type-specific changes needed to strongly type the forms abstractions.

Note: this PR was originally drafted by @alxhub, but I am shepherding it through review, since it will prepare typed forms for an easier API review.

Co-authored-by: alxhub
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor(forms): split apart `model.ts`" (#45168)

Issues.Title: `postinstall: ngcc` required or not in Angular 13 Ivy app consuming Ivy library
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

compiler-cli

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

**Observation 1:** After upgrading an Ivy application to v13, `postinstall: ngcc` wasn't removed automatically during update steps.

**Observation 2:** When a new v13 application is created, `postinstall: ngcc` is not present.

**Query 1:** Is `postinstall: ngcc` required in v13, if the application as well as the library are at the exact same versions of Angular and the corrosponding dependencies and both are Ivy enabled?

**Query 2:** On building an Ivy library, the output `package.json` contains a script that blocks `npm publish`. This has been the behaviour for the past few releases of Angular and now also in v13. Is it due to the on-going development in Ivy area? And do the previous discussed [solution ](https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/41048#issuecomment-791445840)holds true for v13 as well?

**Query 3:** Would it cause any harm(given the above scenario) if we don't use `postinstall: ngcc`? (Also observed that the build time with `ngcc` is around 2.7x as compared to build time without it).

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

_No response_

```true
No error.
```

Issues.Title: URL sanitization breaks URLs containing commas in srcset
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

core

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

Hey,

We're using `[innerHTML]="content"` in angular, where content is HTML from WordPress. WordPress is using cloudinary which generates URLs like 

```
https://res.cloudinary.com/<container>/images/w_844,h_562/f_auto,q_auto/<id>/image.jpg
```

The code that sanitizes `srcset` splits on `,` and joins on `, ` which breaks the URL above.

Code reference: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/packages/core/src/sanitization/url_sanitizer.ts#L58

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

https://codesandbox.io/s/sparkling-resonance-8dyt3u?file=/src/app/app.component.ts

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

```true
If you look at the HTML output, one of the images are broken. The other one works.
```


### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

```true
Angular CLI: 12.0.4
Node: 16.14.0
Package Manager: npm 6.14.13
OS: darwin arm64

Angular: 12.0.4
... animations, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, platform-server
... router

Package                         Version
---------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect       0.1200.4
@angular-devkit/build-angular   12.0.4
@angular-devkit/core            12.0.4
@angular-devkit/schematics      12.0.4
@angular/cdk                    12.1.0
@angular/material               12.1.0
@nguniversal/builders           12.0.2
@nguniversal/express-engine     12.0.2
@schematics/angular             12.0.4
rxjs                            6.6.7
typescript                      4.2.4
```


### Anything else?

A fix could be to join on "," instead. Though it will try to sanitize URLs which aren't URLs.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "URL sanitization breaks URLs containing commas in srcset" (#45164)

Issues.Title: feat(core): allow for injector to be specified when creating an embedded view
Issues.Body:
Adds support for passing in an optional injector when creating an embedded view through `ViewContainerRef.createEmbeddedView` and `TemplateRef.createEmbeddedView`. The injector allows for the DI behavior to be customized within the specific template.

This is a second stab at the changes in #44666. The difference this time is that the new injector acts as a node injector, rather than a module injector.

Fixes #14935.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(core): allow for injector to be specified when creating an embedded view" (#45156)

Issues.Title: tslint replacement
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/releated to the feature request?

_No response_

### Description

Although tslint is deprecated and the Angular team suggests switching to eslint, our team tried 3-4 times already to switch to the latter and it has always been painful. With the latest release of all packages, Angular 13, eslint 8.9.0, angular-eslint 13.1.0 and typescript-eslint 5.11.0, our project takes around 40 minutes 😱 to lint, which of course makes it impossible to integrate into any CI workflow. The experience is much better on individual files within vscode.

I've read all the articles about improving the performance, and I tried some solutions without any result, but really, this is a tool that's supposed to work out-of-the-box with minimal configuration, we can't spend so much time trying to get it right, especially when tslint just worked.

Furthermore, I noticed that even the Angular and Angular Material teams haven't switched to eslint yet, you're both still on tslint. In fact, I couldn't find any Angular project of considerable size on github that has switched to eslint. Granted, I didn't expect to find any, because I guess Angular is used mostly in corporate environments, intranet applications and so on, so it's difficult to find code hosted on public repos.

### Proposed solution

So, perhaps we should revisit the decision to drop tslint or suggest a better alternative? I don't have a suggestion of course, just pointing out the obvious issues.

I'd really like to hear from people working on big Angular projects, especially with monorepo structures, multiple projects and libraries inside.

### Alternatives considered

eslint with angular-eslint.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "tslint replacement" (#45153)

Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

forms

### Is this a regression?

Not sure

### Description

If you create a checkbox input using a dynamic value for the `type` attribute, the FormControl value does not appear to be bound correctly to the input value.

Dynamic definition for control:

```
control = {
    key: 'test',
    type: 'checkbox',
    value: true
  }

form = new FormGroup({
  [control.key]: new FormControl(control.value)
});
```

Template markup:

```html
<form [formGroup]="form">
    <input [formControlName]="control.key"
      [id]="control.key"
      [name]="control.key"
      [type]="control.type">
</form>
```

The resulting html wrongly includes a `value` attribute that is set to the initial value of `true`. And the initial visual checked state of the checkbox is incorrect - it's unchecked

```html
<input  id="test" name="test" type="checkbox" value="true" class="ng-valid ng-dirty ng-touched">
```

When the checkbox is toggled the FormControl value is set to 'true' and then does not change.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

When the `type` attribute of the input is explicitly set to `'checkbox'` the `value` attribute is not set on the input and it functions correctly (https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-ivy-fypwkc?file=src%2Fapp%2Fapp.component.html)

```html
<form [formGroup]="form">
    <input [formControlName]="control.key"
      [id]="control.key"
      [name]="control.key"
      type="checkbox">
</form>
```

Results in:

```html
<input type="checkbox" id="test" name="test" class="ng-pristine ng-valid ng-touched">
```


This issue can also be demonstrated using an extended version of the 'Building dynamic forms' example that can be found here https://angular.io/guide/dynamic-form

https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-qxye7f?file=src%2Fapp%2Fapp.component.ts

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-ivy-n7qtgf?file=src%2Fapp%2Fapp.component.html


### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

```true
Angular CLI: 13.1.2
Node: 16.13.2
Package Manager: npm 8.3.1
OS: darwin x64

Angular: 13.1.1
... animations, cdk, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... material, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, router

Package                         Version
---------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect       0.1301.2
@angular-devkit/build-angular   13.1.2
@angular-devkit/core            13.1.2
@angular-devkit/schematics      13.1.2
@angular/cli                    13.1.2
@schematics/angular             13.1.2
rxjs                            7.4.0
typescript                      4.5.4
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Creating a checkbox with the type attribute as a bound variable (instead of explicitly declaring type="checkbox") does not appear to bind the FormControl value to the input" (#45150)

Issues.Title: test(animations): add route animation delay to pages tests
Issues.Body:
PR #44550 introduced an animation for pages/tabs transitions in the
animations example application, after such change intermittent e2e
failures started to occur (see for example: #45083), add a delay to
account for such animation to all the animations pages/tabs e2e tests so
to fix the flakyness caused by the animation

@jessicajaniuk I am opening this PR as I saw other animations example e2e fails (specifically here: #45142), so I've been thinking and one thing that I changed is the animation between the pages/tabs in the example, and I did not add anything in the e2es to account for that, so I think that may be actually the thing causing the issues (and its duration matches with the milliseconds we needed to add to the initial sleep calls).

I am sort of going out on a limb here, but it soft of does make sense and checks out what we've been seeing, please let me know what you think :slightly_smiling_face:

Issues.Title: Assignment of an asynchronous expression to a variable
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/releated to the feature request?

_No response_

### Description

if we do <someElement *ngIf="someSubject | async as myValue"> we can enjoy that `myValue` can used many times while only one subscription is being made.

Is it already possible to basically do the `someSubject | async as myValue` semantics, but without `*ngIf`, because the possibility to use a local variable for the result of the expression using only one subscription applies in many situations, where no condition should be used, simply in order to minimize the number of subscriptions.

If it's already possible, how do you actually do that?

Otherwise, I would suggest to introduce such a feature.



### Proposed solution

Please see above.

### Alternatives considered

I think you need to be quite fluent in Angular details in order to suggest some alternative.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Assignment of an asynchronous expression to a variable" (#45139)

Issues.Title: ci: use renovate Github Action tag version pinning
Issues.Body:
Renovate supports using hashed version pinning for individual Github actions while still following SemVer-based tags.
All workflow actions external to the Angular organization now leverage this support to ensure both that stable versions of the actions are used and that the actions are pinned to a hashed version of the tag.

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): find `ngswConfig` as relative to the application root
Issues.Body:
Previously when determining the `configPath` for building the service worker, the config path
was loaded as a relative path to location where  execution of ng build occured.  Instead the
`ngswConfig` value provided in `angular.json` should be considered relative to th application
root, as is the case with the other paths provided in the configuration.

Before this change, assuming a project root of `/project`, and a `ngswConfig` value of `ngsw-config.json`,
the application built successfully when the exuction working directory was `/project`, but if the
user invoked ng build from `/project/src` for instance, the build failed as `ngsw-config.json` does not
exist at `/project/src/ngsw-config.json`.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): find `ngswConfig` as relative to the application root" (#22749)

**Note:** Version bump only for package [@​typescript-eslint/parser](https://togithub.com/typescript-eslint/parser)

</details>

<details>
<summary>evanw/esbuild</summary>

### [`v0.14.23`](https://togithub.com/evanw/esbuild/blob/HEAD/CHANGELOG.md#​01423)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/evanw/esbuild/compare/v0.14.22...v0.14.23)

-   Update feature database to indicate that node 16.14+ supports import assertions ([#​2030](https://togithub.com/evanw/esbuild/issues/2030))

    Node versions 16.14 and above now support import assertions according to [these release notes](https://togithub.com/nodejs/node/blob/6db686710ee1579452b2908a7a41b91cb729b944/doc/changelogs/CHANGELOG_V16.md#​16.14.0). This release updates esbuild's internal feature compatibility database with this information, so esbuild no longer strips import assertions with `--target=node16.14`:

    ```js
    // Original code
    import data from './package.json' assert { type: 'json' }
    console.log(data)

    // Old output (with --target=node16.14)
    import data from "./package.json";
    console.log(data);

    // New output (with --target=node16.14)
    import data from "./package.json" assert { type: "json" };
    console.log(data);
    ```

-   Basic support for CSS `@layer` rules ([#​2027](https://togithub.com/evanw/esbuild/issues/2027))

    This adds basic parsing support for a new CSS feature called `@layer` that changes how the CSS cascade works. Adding parsing support for this rule to esbuild means esbuild can now minify the contents of `@layer` rules:

    ```css
    /* Original code */
    @​layer a {
      @​layer b {
        div {
          color: yellow;
          margin: 0.0px;
        }
      }
    }

    /* Old output (with --minify) */
    @​layer a{@​layer b {div {color: yellow; margin: 0px;}}}

    /* New output (with --minify) */
    @​layer a.b{div{color:#ff0;margin:0}}
    ```

    You can read more about `@layer` here:

    -   Documentation: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/[@​layer](https://togithub.com/layer)
    -   Motivation: https://developer.chrome.com/blog/cascade-layers/

    Note that the support added in this release is only for parsing and printing `@layer` rules. The bundler does not yet know about these rules and bundling with `@layer` may result in behavior changes since these new rules have unusual ordering constraints that behave differently than all other CSS rules. Specifically the order is derived from the *first* instance while with every other CSS rule, the order is derived from the *last* instance.

</details>

Issues.Title: "Optional chaining cannot appear in left-hand side" Suddenly appeared.
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

compiler-cli, compiler



### Description

Suddenly my app will not build.  I know what `optional chaining` is. and I tried looking for things in my code that were handled wrong but the app is large and I lack context to narrow the search down. 

unfortunately i cannot pin point any code or change that has caused this error. The error is very vague and does not point out where in the code to debug. and may have been introduced when we updated ng and typescript all-though that is not confirmed.

![Screen Shot 2022-02-21 at 12 13 59 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15847500/155008115-4ad81778-b050-4c01-bcdc-0532d7e12002.png)




### exception found during 'ng build'

```true

Optional chaining cannot appear in left-hand side (Note that you need plugins to import files that are not JavaScript)

(node-resolve) resolveId "../shared/services/flamelink.service" "/Users/omar/Sites/met-libs-nx/dist/libs/cms/esm2020/lib/schema-panel/schema-builder.service.mjs"
(node-resolve) resolveId "../shared/services/db_paths" "/Users/omar/Sites/met-libs-nx/dist/libs/cms/esm2020/lib/schema-panel/schema-builder.service.mjs"
...
```



```true
Angular CLI: 13.2.4
Node: 14.16.0
Package Manager: npm 6.14.11
OS: darwin x64

Angular: 13.2.3
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms

---------------------------------------------------------
```

### anything helps

I am looking for any info that will assist me in debugging this issue. Please help! I will rewrite this question or provide any additional info but at the moment this is all the relevant info I have. 

I used vscode regex search to find any `?` before an `=` in the project but i did not find any. Are there tips similar to this that would help me narrow the hunt down?

Do you think this is syntax error or a version number? Anything helps

Issues.Title: Optimization breaks code
Issues.Body:
The optimization process of Angular breaks code with side effects.

This literally wasted many dev hours of debugging to find out.

Optimization is must-have feature, otherwise the dist is 3-4 times the size. Side effects make up maybe 1% of that.

This can only be fixed by ugly workarounds, forcing to import scripts not in the intended "Angular" way.

Issues.Title: Suggestion/request: Make Angular CLI a NX plugin - to help minimise the code maintained by Angular itself
Issues.Body:
From my understanding, Google doesn't use Angular CLI. This means they are maintaining this for the good of the Angular community. With Nrwl NX starting to become standard in a lot of Angular applications. Would it now make sense to slimline Angular CLI to become a plugin built to NX/ a wrapper to NX CLI?

This could help community engagement, and you can focus on creating the generators and builders. 

If not drop would it be a worth pointing to a "community" alternative for people inside the documentation?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Suggestion/request: Make Angular CLI a NX plugin - to help minimise the code maintained by Angular itself" (#22727)

Issues.Title: bug(material/input): name property setting overrides developer defined name property
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [X] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

v13.1.2

### Description

This [change](https://github.com/angular/components/commit/feac08f13843e3476245535a7fa5f3dfee04b027) broke a lot of code. The issue is tons of code was adapted to the fact that Angular Material input was not setting name attribute, so they directly set it themselves. Now with this change Angular Material Input overrides that.

For example, see [Covalent Dynamic Forms Input](https://github.com/Teradata/covalent/blob/main/src/platform/dynamic-forms/dynamic-elements/dynamic-input/dynamic-input.component.html)

### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. Set name attribute on a mat-input field directly with `[attr.name]="name"`
2. Try to access element by name attribute, such as in tests.


### Expected Behavior

If name attribute is directly set, then Angular Material Input needs to set name attribute more carefully.

### Actual Behavior

Angular Material Input overrides name attribute directly set by user of mat-input.

### Environment

- Angular: 13.2.2
- CDK/Material: 13.2.2
- Browser(s): Any
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Any
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(material/input): name property setting overrides developer defined name property" (#24463)

Issues.Title: feat(material/menu): support zone-less mode
Issues.Body:
The template:

```html
<button mat-button [matMenuTriggerFor]="menu">Menu</button>
<mat-menu #menu="matMenu">
  <button mat-menu-item>Item 1</button>
  <button mat-menu-item>Item 2</button>
</mat-menu>
```

Basically, the `mat-menu` is never opened when the zone is nooped through `{ ngZone: 'noop' }`. I've left comments near my changes. The CI will prolly fail so I'll fix it after it's run.

### Before
https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7337691/154817177-e83822d7-6fb1-487c-b101-57385deed9bb.mp4

### After
https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7337691/154817212-5cc30100-5c74-4b19-9c49-66910238633c.mp4
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(material/menu): support zone-less mode" (#24452)

Issues.Title: bug(mat-select): has different height than matInput
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

13.2.3

### Description

If you render a mat-input and a mat-select component next to each other you can see that mat-select is slightly higher than the mat-input. This is a specific `appearance="outline"` issue. Using `appearance="fill"` the height is the exact same. (see https://material.angular.io/components/form-field/examples)

## Mat Input

### mat-form-field

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5478899/154712545-7fea10e1-2e5d-49ce-af3f-c0b2f50b123a.png)

### .mat-form-field-infix

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5478899/154712890-092184bd-cc86-41c4-824f-3198eaad53c0.png)

## Mat Select

### mat-form-field

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5478899/154712628-de0abce8-fb92-4e46-9432-360335ee21d5.png)

### .mat-form-field-infix

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5478899/154712984-8c5a44b7-827d-4bdc-9f2e-9d4930baec0f.png)



### Reproduction

[StackBlitz Demo](https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-u1v9f4-pne1zy?file=src%2Fapp%2Fform-field-overview-example.html
)

### Expected Behavior

All form components should have the same height.

### Actual Behavior

The height is different when using `appearance="outline"`

### Environment

- Angular: 13.0.x
- CDK/Material: 13.2.3
- Browser(s): Chrome 98.0.4758.102
- Operating System Windows
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(mat-select): has different height than matInput" (#24446)

### Description

When i add a new tab dynamically from a button, if i choose to set the new tab as first item in the tab list and want it to select this tab, it does nothing.

### Expected Behavior

### Actual Behavior

it does not change the current tab

### Environment

- Angular: 13 
- CDK/Material:  13
- Browser(s): Chrome

Issues.Title: bug(mat-form-field): PLACEHOLDER IS EMPTY BY DEFAULT
Issues.Body:
Please look at the
### Full Explanation [here](https://github.com/angular/components/issues/23893#)

This is either a bug or the documentation should be changed. 

[Here](https://material.angular.io/components/form-field/overview) it states:
"If you want to create a legacy form field with a placeholder but no label, **you will need to specify an empty label** to prevent the placeholder from being promoted."

Together with this code:
```
<mat-form-field>
  <mat-label></mat-label>
  <input placeholder="Just a placeholder">
</mat-form-field>
```

However **the `<mat-label></mat-label>` prevents** the placeholder to be **displayed**.

Current Solution: Remove the mat-label
```
<mat-form-field>
  <input placeholder="Just a placeholder">
</mat-form-field>
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(mat-form-field): PLACEHOLDER IS EMPTY BY DEFAULT" (#24444)

Issues.Title: bug(MODAL): If starting keyboard navigation from the URL bar - modal is not focused first!
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

When I am using the app normally and open the popup, I am able to circle through the content in modal window well with my TAB key...

The problem is when I focus my URL input box in browser and then try to cycle with TAB there to the page... the APP under the modal gets focused first and not the modal itself! Once I get to the modal, it stays in the modal correctly and cannot cycle out.

the only solutions to this would be to inject the modal before the app-root, or I did put the tabindex of the app-root to -1 and the modal first element to 1 - seems to do the trick

### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1.  Open modal window
2. Click on browser's URL bar
3. press TAB many times in order to get to the PAGE
4. Observe what get's focused


### Expected Behavior

I expect that when the modal is opened, it gets accessed first with key navigation

### Actual Behavior

When starting cycling with TAB key from the url bar, the page under the modal gets accessed first

### Environment

- Angular: 12.2.11
- CDK/Material: 12.2.9
- Browser(s): Chrome 98
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(MODAL): If starting keyboard navigation from the URL bar - modal is not focused first!" (#24443)

Issues.Title: Extend MatFormFieldDefaultOptions with color.
Issues.Body:
Setting color on every element: 

```html
<mat-form-field color="accent" />
```

could be replaced by global setting in app module:

```ts
{ provide: MAT_FORM_FIELD_DEFAULT_OPTIONS, useValue: { appearance: 'fill', color: 'accent' } }
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Extend MatFormFieldDefaultOptions with color." (#24438)

Issues.Title: bug(matChipRemove): matChipRemove does not preventDefault()
Issues.Body: ### Is this a regression? - [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version ### The previous version in which this bug was not present was _No response_ ### Description matChipRemove does not `preventDefault()`, allowing standard click behavior like following a parent hyperlink to trigger. matChipRemove does `stopPropagation()` though. ### Reproduction Steps to reproduce: https://stackblitz.com/edit/components-issue-va7p6c?file=src%2Fapp%2Fexample-component.html ```html example.org close ``` ### Expected Behavior Clicking on matChipRemove should fully consume the event, including `preventDefault()`. ### Actual Behavior Clicking on matChipRemove triggers the parent hyperlink. ### Environment - Angular: 12.2.9 - CDK/Material: 12.2.9 - Browser(s): Chrome 98 - Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): macOS 12.2
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(matChipRemove): matChipRemove does not preventDefault()" (#24436)
